content.text: Receive the TSD/MSc certificate together with their MSc diploma. With the certificate the TU/e declares that the owners are also experts of sustainable development within their field of expertise * 20 ects (10 ects on top of regular program) * 10 ects core courses, 1 other course from list, 1 project course * receive the TSD/MSc certificate together with their Master of Science diploma. With the certificate the TU/e declares that the owners are also experts of sustainable development within their field of expertise

Binnen de track Innovation Strategy leer je hoe je innovatieprocessen in de kenniseconomie kunt begrijpen, beheren en beïnvloeden. Binnen de track Innovation Strategy leer je hoe je innovatieprocessen in de kenniseconomie kunt begrijpen, beheren en beïnvloeden. Afgestudeerden vinden een baan als beleidsmaker, consultant of als strategisch innovatiemanager in een groot bedrijf.

De Special / Free track is gereserveerd voor studenten wiens interesses niet gedekt worden door de Global Sustainability of Innovation Strategy and Policy track. De Special / Free track is gereserveerd voor studenten wiens interesses niet gedekt worden door de Global Sustainability of Innovation Strategy and Policy track. Studenten die voor deze track willen kiezen, moeten duidelijk kunnen beargumenteren waarom ze een alternatief programma in de vrije track willen doen en waarom dit programma ook het doel, de leerdoelen en de eisen van de master.Innovation Sciences dekt. Alle specialisaties en vrije keuzevakken moeten worden bepaald in nauwe samenwerking met de persoonlijke mentor en worden goedgekeurd door de programmavoorzitter en de examencommissie. Net als in de reguliere tracks is het verplicht om ten minste 10 ECTS ingenieurswetenschappelijke vakken te kiezen (dit kan ook in de keuzevakken), evenals het doen van een internationaal semester.

Deze track is bedoeld voor excellente (honours) studenten die hun eigen masterprogramma willen ontwerpen. Dit gaat altijd in nauwe samenwerking met de persoonlijke mentor, om goedgekeurd te worden door de Program Director IE (in geval van het Honours programma) of de Program Managers (in geval van een dual degree).

Ben je op zoek naar meer uitdaging in je bacheloropleiding? Sluit je dan aan bij de Honors Academy van de Technische Universiteit Eindhoven. Bij de Academy kan je kiezen uit verschillende Honors Tracks voor tijdens je bachelor.

Ben je geïnteresseerd in het behalen van je tweede graads bevoegdheid? Je hebt de mogelijkheid om een Educatieve Module te volgen waarin je na afloop een certificaat ontvangt. (alleen Nederlandstalig)

In the Environmental Psychology track, we examine the interrelationship between people and their physical and social surroundings. Although humans evolved in nature, most people in the Western world spend more than 90% of their time indoors. These spaces are also growing ever more complex and are augmented by digital layers of media, sensing technologies and smart automated systems. Do intelligent buildings optimally balance sustainability, well-being, health and performance or do they frustrate users by taking away autonomy and control? Perhaps even pampering us into ever more vulnerable, ill-adapted and demanding indoor creatures? Are the spaces we design actually optimal for human functioning? These are the themes that form the core of Human-Technology Interaction's Environmental Psychology track. Students will learn to leverage elements such as media, tracking and sensing technology, virtual reality (VR) modeling, simulation software, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques to investigate the impact of our natural, built and social environments on people, as well as to explore ways of designing environments in which occupants can truly thrive. What if we feel happier and more comfortable in spaces in which we operate the lights, blinds and windows ourselves? What is ...

HTI's Human-Centered AI track aims to shed light on this based on insights from cognitive psychology, user experience (UX) design, human-AI interaction and the philosophy and ethics of AI. How can our interactions with AI-driven systems and products be understood and optimally designed? By combining a human-centered perspective and specific technical knowledge (such as machine learning and explainable AI), you will have opportunities to design and evaluate the ways in which people interact with algorithms and automation in various contexts of current and emerging AI applications, including recommender systems, social robotics and creative AI. You will acquire the knowledge and skills to assess new AI developments in view of human values, goals, constraints and capabilities. In this track, you will be able to learn and integrate such insights with a certain level of technical knowledge about AI methods in order to become a competent engineer of human-AI interaction who considers human values at the core of their work. How can we make sure that people trust highly automated systems? Will generative models reshape the ways in which creative workers go about their practice? And how can we safeguard the development of AI in all these areas so that it enhances rather than undermines human values? Inspired? Human-centered AI may be the right track for you.

The track aims to shed light on how our relationships with robots should be understood and designed for, offering critical perspectives on the role and impact of social robots in society. Based on insights from social psychology, social robotics, human-centered AI and technology ethics, students study and assess the latest advancements in social robotics and their roles in healthcare, industry, education, customer service, policing and more. They also grow their skillsets in technical tools and research methods to investigate human-robot interaction, particularly in relation to sensing and understanding human behavior (such as respecting the human's personal space), designing appropriate robot social behaviors based on user needs and contexts of use, and critically reflecting on and investigating whether the current design of robots (like humanoid robots) can be detrimental to social justice. Can we design robots to care for our aging population? How can we ensure that a robot will always serve a human's best interests? Do people respond to robots as if responding to a human? How might the increasing presence of robots in society influence our human relationships? Are children allowed to bully a social robot? And should a sex robot be able to say 'no'? If these questions inspire you, Robots for Humans may be the right track for you.

The track offers in-depth interdisciplinary perspectives on technology entrepreneurship alongside hands-on approaches to (sustainable) business development and strategy. This track is designed for students with a technical or engineering bachelor's degree who are looking to further develop their knowledge and skills in the innovation, management and entrepreneurship domains focused on the (sustainable) commercialization of new technology in high-tech sectors. Technology Entrepreneurship & Strategy also welcomes students with a business, economics or social sciences background who wish to further develop their knowledge and skills in the innovation, management and entrepreneurship domain in a high-tech setting. The Technology Entrepreneurship & Strategy track promotes the development of integral knowledge and skills needed to strategize the various elements of the entrepreneurial process under high levels of uncertainty. In doing so, students come to understand how technology-based entrepreneurship can generate sustainable economic and societal value creation as they develop expertise in areas such as technology commercialization, business model (canvas) development and iteration, financial decision-making and funding, customer and market creation, stakeholder management, and circularity and lifecycle assessment. Furthermore, students develop ...

When you want to understand how digital innovation (like AI, IoT and digital twins) affects and changes society, this track offers practical, in-depth experience. Think of smart cities, predictive policing systems, navigation systems, chatbots and digital assistants. These are all examples of AI and other digital technologies that have already become integral to our daily lives. What does this mean from both a technological and ethical perspective? In AI and Digital Innovation, students learn how to understand and consider human and societal needs and values – such as explainability, transparency and sustainability – as part of AI systems design and digital innovation. The track's multidisciplinary approach enables students to design and develop sustainable digital solutions using responsible AI and other digital technologies in order to support organizations and society on innovation with data. This helps to put our students at the forefront of sustainable digital innovation, a domain set to grow even further in size and importance. This track targets students who wish to gain hands-on, technical and state-of-the-art insights into the design of AI systems. This will allow them to translate organizational and societal needs into digital innovations and digital (AI) system designs that are both sustainable and responsible.

By following the IM Sustainability Transitions track, you have a unique opportunity to study how change can be shaped at the intersection between high tech, innovation and sustainability. Technology and innovation play a key role in transitioning to more just and sustainable futures. This track will provide you with analytical tools and insights that will help you in your future work in combining technology, innovation and sustainability. You will learn how to engage with the challenging process of transitioning towards sustainability. Many actors are involved – from firms to NGOs and from policymakers to civil society – and must navigate complex trade-offs and controversies that arise along the way. Transitions towards sustainability ask us to think about systemic change and to deal with the interconnectedness of our global challenges. They require approaches that combine insights from both Innovation Management and Transition Studies. This track will give you deep insights into state-of the art thinking about sustainability transitions and innovation, specifically around the interactions between technology and society. You will learn about global difficulties and synergies that emerge when transitioning towards more sustainable societies. You will be introduced to theories and tools that will help you understand and assess the sustainability of products and ...

The track is particularly valuable for students interested in developing greater knowledge in innovation strategy, high-tech marketing, open innovation, customer experience and servitization. In Innovation Management's Collaborative Innovation & Marketing track, students gain a deep understanding of the strategic and operational decisions involved when managing an ecosystem of stakeholders in order to realize innovations that provide maximum customer value and move to sustainable solutions. This focus is unique as no other master's program in the Netherlands highlights the intersection between marketing and innovation so elaborately. The track shows how companies can be more successful in creating and commercializing new products and services through active coordination of the value chain and supply chain. The track covers both radical and incremental innovation in business-to-business and business-to-consumer markets. Special attention is paid to the transition of firms from creating and selling products to service solutions (servitization), as this is a way to be more sustainable and, at the same time, create more immersive customer experiences. After completing the track, students will be familiar with state-of-the-art concepts and tools for how companies can involve individuals and organizations in developing and launching innovative products and service solutions

This track offers a unique opportunity to align the technological, organizational and personal factors that enable excellent innovative performance. To achieve superior performance in a sustainable manner and to secure a competitive advantage, the generation and implementation of innovative ideas is key to contemporary organizing. At the same time, leading and organizing innovation are among the most challenging aspects for leaders. In this track, students therefore learn to integrate psychological insights and engineering science in the various stages of an innovation process so that organizations can excel in innovative and sustainable endeavors. This includes an introduction to managing and supporting people such that they can flourish in various innovation contexts, including open innovation, R&D teams and AI-supported innovation in a high-tech environment. After completing this track, students will have state-of-the-art knowledge regarding the importance of the human factor in the innovation process of high-tech and knowledge-intensive organizations. Students will develop research skills that enable them to examine and evaluate current innovation processes and learn how to apply those insights to design management interventions in order to boost performance, sustainability and innovation excellence.

The Analytics for Transport and Mobility track combines a strong methodological basis with scientific operational domain knowledge and a focus on relevant research methods and design competency. Major topics include business models, network design, scheduling and routing optimization, last-mile logistics, car sharing, on-demand transportation, intermodal traffic management and demand management. In addressing these themes, students explore the limits of artificial intelligence, machine learning and data analytics and learn how to apply these techniques to improve transportation efficiency – all while understanding and keeping in mind the role of human performance in mobility. By the end of the track, students will have developed themselves as global citizens through meaningful interactions with international staff and students, as well as the option to go abroad for an international semester. This track is designed for students who want to make a difference to the future of transportation and mobility. Are you ready to become an expert in the rapidly evolving transportation and mobility sector? Are you interested in learning how to efficiently plan routes, design innovative business models and manage the growing demand for transportation services? If so, Analytics for Transport and Mobility may be the track for you.

Given the global ambition to be more sustainable, flexible, resilient and cost-effective, trends are creating new challenges. Challenges that students of this track are equipped to address. Within the Smart Industry track, the main topics include data-driven production planning and control, AI-driven decision support, business process optimization, AI-driven process management, digital and sustainable factories, collaborative manufacturing, design and real-time control of material handling systems, predictive maintenance, service control towers, and human performance. In addressing these themes, students gain a strong methodological basis, scientific operational domain knowledge on manufacturing and maintenance, competency in smart industry design and a keen focus on relevant research methods such as AI. By the end of the track, students will have developed themselves as global citizens through meaningful interactions with international staff and students, as well as the option to go abroad for an international semester. Would you like to absorb comprehensive know-how in the field of operations, supply chain and logistics and grow into a leadership role? And would you like to apply this to the world of industry, such as to boost the sustainability and resilience of manufacturing chains worldwide? If so, this may be the track for you.

This track focuses on state-of-the art methods, techniques and tools for designing intelligent, value-driven, high-quality and cost-effective service solutions that meet customer demands. Students of the Smart Services track are equipped with the necessary skills and knowledge to systematically integrate business goals, processes, data, people and innovative digital technologies. The main topics within this include service engineering, AI-driven decision support, digitally-enabled business models, business process management, digital transformation, process mining, enterprise architecture and human performance. The track provides students with a strong methodological basis, scientific operational domain knowledge on services, a focus on relevant research methods and competency in the design of smart services. What makes smart services smart? Such services are often characterized by their capacity to leverage data, automation and connectivity in order to deliver enhanced and personalized experiences to users, making them more efficient and responsive. Would you like to gain a deeper understanding of how these services can be designed, developed and improved? If so, Smart Services may be the track for you.

Achieve a fundamental understanding of supply chain management from a global perspective, with an emphasis on leveraging the effects of operations on business performance and objectives. The main topics in this track include multi-echelon inventory optimization, AI-driven decision support, business process optimization, supply chain operations design, collaboration/competition, demand and supply uncertainty management, and human performance. By investigating these themes, students gain a strong methodological basis, scientific operational domain knowledge on supply chain management, competency in the design of supply chain management and a sharp focus on relevant research methods like AI. What are the most novel techniques and expertise to analyze and optimize supply chain functions? What takes place during end-of-lifecycle operations? How can innovative supply chain technologies address industry challenges in a high-tech, data-intensive world? If you find these questions appealing, Supply Chain Management may be the track for you.
Vloeistoffen, Bio- en Zachte Materie concentreert de aandacht op de natuurkunde van vloeistoffen en zachte materialen zonder de natuurkunde in de volle breedte uit het oog te verliezen.
Plasmawetenschap is een zeer interdisciplinair onderzoeksveld waarin geïoniseerde gassen een centrale rol spelen.

Ben je op zoek naar meer uitdaging in je bacheloropleiding? Sluit je dan aan bij de Honors Academy van de Technische Universiteit Eindhoven. Bij de Academy kan je kiezen uit verschillende Honors Tracks voor tijdens je bachelor.

Bij AMS is het belangrijk dat je materialen fundamenteel leert begrijpen zodat je ze kunt omvormen tot tastbare apparaten. Je beheerst de experimentele en digitale instrumenten die nodig zijn om producten te vervaardigen. De elementaire basis van deze mastertrack helpt je om een veelzijdige specialist te worden die door technologische doorbraken een verschil kan maken in de industrie en onze samenleving. Door de multidisciplinariteit van de track, een kernprincipe van mechanical engineering, kun je in je leeromgeving ervaren hoe je effectief kunt samenwerken in onderzoeks- en ontwikkelingsteams - in de industrie of in kennisinstellingen - zoals in het ecosysteem van Brainport.

In de Mastertrack Computational Engineering verwerf je de kennis en vaardigheden om computationele methodes, kunstmatige intelligentie en wiskundige modellen te begrijpen en toe te passen in de werktuigbouwkunde. Met deze expertise ontwikkel je jezelf tot een computationele ingenieur die complexe technische vraagstukken op een creatieve manier kan benaderen met behulp van simulaties en gegevensanalyse. Dankzij je interdisciplinaire profiel ben je in staat effectief samen te werken in diverse teams; een zeer gewilde eigenschap binnen zowel de industriële sector als de onderzoeksgemeenschap. Als je de ins en outs kent van programmeren, algoritmeontwikkeling en gegevensbeheer, heb je niet alleen meer mogelijkheden op het gebied van techniek, maar openen zich ook deuren in sectoren waar een grote vraag is naar computationele vaardigheden.

In de Mastertrack Energy Conversion and Storage komen onderwerpen samen die relevant zijn voor de energietransitie. Thema's die aan bod komen zijn onder meer schone motoren, brandstoffen en oplossingen voor energieopslag. Deze oplossingen richten zich op verschillende toepassingsniveaus; van duurzame huizen tot industriële verwerking en toepassingen op systeemniveau. Door berekeningen en experimenten uit te voeren, leer je hoe je de techniek van energiesystemen, machines en materialen kunt verbeteren. Je past daarbij essentiële fundamentele principes toe van geavanceerde thermodynamica en stromingsmechanica.

We stomen je klaar voor uitdagingen in de energietransitie waar jij wel raad mee weet als toekomstig ingenieur die afstudeert in deze mastertrack. We werken met je samen bij het ontwikkelen van oplossingen voor het decarboniseren van de energiesector en het optimaliseren van de stroming.

Bij Engineering Fluid Mechanics verwerf je fundamenteel inzicht in vloeistofstromingen en leer je de tools te beheersen om die kennis te gebruiken voor de ontwikkeling van technologische innovaties. De basis van deze mastertrack helpt je om een specialist in vloeistofmechanica te worden, waarbij je een impact hebt op een breed scala aan gebieden en toepassingen. Door de aandacht voor multidisciplinariteit in deze mastertrack, die kenmerkend is voor een werktuigbouwkundig ingenieur, word je opgeleid tot een effectieve teamspeler in een onderzoeks- en ontwikkelingsomgeving.

Als jij jezelf ziet als dé specialist tot wie toepassingsgerichte collega's zich wenden voor gedegen advies over mechanica-georiënteerde uitdagingen, dan is deze mastertrack een goed uitgangspunt om je visie te verwezenlijken. Als jij de ingenieur wilt zijn die de conceptuele ontwerpen van anderen omzet in realiteit, heeft ESM daarvoor alles in huis. Als nauwkeurig werken in jouw dna zit, net als het systematisch oplossen van problemen, dan past deze mastertrack wellicht goed bij je. We zijn een team van toegewijde, toegankelijke docenten en helpen je graag je toekomst vorm te geven door middel van een stevig vakinhoudelijk fundament.

products.title: Materials for High Tech Systems Design

content.text: Aan bod komen thema's als materiaalkunde, continuümmechanica, experimentele technieken, computationele mechanica, systeemontwerp, optimalisatie en meer. Material for High Tech Systems Design behandelt een verscheidenheid van verschillende onderwerpen . Deze mastertrack rust op drie pijlers van de wetenschap: experimenten, theorie en simulaties. Gespecialiseerde laboratoria (zoals het Multiscale lab, het Mechanical Testing lab en het Polymer Processing Lab) en krachtige computerfaciliteiten nemen binnen ons onderwijs en onderzoek een centrale plek in. MHS voorziet je van de vaardigheden en kennis om deze voorzieningen te gebruiken, inclusief training in softwareontwikkeling en state-of-the-art simulatietools (zowel open source-codes als commerciële pakketten).

In deze mastertrack leer je hoe je met systeemdenken hightechoplossingen kunt ontwikkelen voor complexe problemen. Vanuit de opleiding krijg je op gegevens en modellen gebaseerde tools aangereikt om mechanisch-dynamische systemen te ontwerpen, optimaliseren en besturen. Aan de hand van ontwerpprincipes ervaar je hoe je onzekerheden en variaties in het proces, de werking en de omgeving kunt inschatten om op basis hiervan beslissingen te kunnen nemen. Je leert ook belangrijke aspecten in het ontwerp van hightechsystemen en robotica te integreren. Dit kan gaan om operatorondersteuning voor het onderhoud van hightechapparatuur, detectie en identificatie van storingen, veiligheid en geoptimaliseerde prestaties, maar ook om materiaalontwerp en materiaaleigenschappen.

Met de Mastertrack Robotics betreed je een wereld van concrete expertise en praktische toepassingen. Je verdiept je in de complexe aspecten van dynamische manipulatie en mobiele robots met een sterke focus op de basisprincipes van regeltechniek. Verder werk je aan de interactie tussen robot en mens, perceptie en gedrag van robotteams. Denk je eens in dat je robots programmeert die door complexe omgevingen navigeren, systemen ontwikkelt die naadloos samenwerken met mensen of juist volledig autonoom in nabijheid van mensen. Hoe zou het zijn om robotteams te laten coördineren zodat ze complexe taken uitvoeren? Aan de hand van praktijkervaring in moderne laboratoria en gezamenlijke projecten bouw je in deze gespecialiseerde opleiding expertise op. Je ontwikkelt niet alleen technische vaardigheden maar gaat ook deel uitmaken van een hechte gemeenschap, waarin je leert van de wetenschappers in de faculteit en samenwerkt met andere robotica-fanaten, waaronder voormalige MSc- en PhD-studenten en PostDocs die nu werkzaam zijn in de sector.

De HySET-track is een internationaal Erasmus Mundus-programma dat professionals opleidt voor de innovatieve waterstofsector met multidisciplinaire kennis en praktijkervaring. HySET – Hydrogen Systems and Enabling Technologies is een internationale mastertrack binnen de master Chemical Engineering and Chemistry, gericht op het opleiden van experts voor de groeiende waterstofsector. Dit Erasmus Mundus-programma biedt multidisciplinaire kennis en praktische ervaring bij toonaangevende universiteiten in Europa.

Het tweejarige programma (120 ECTS) combineert fundamentele kennis, industriële toepassingen en internationaal onderwijs. In het eerste jaar studeer je aan Politecnico di Torino of Politecnico di Milano, waar je een solide basis in waterstoftechnologie opbouwt. Het tweede jaar vindt plaats aan een van de uitstapuniversiteiten, zoals TU/e, NTNU of UPC. Bij de TU/e volg je gespecialiseerde vakken en werk je aan een afstudeerproject.
HySET biedt een unieke kans om internationale ervaring op te doen en je carrière te starten in een innovatieve industrie met wereldwijde impact.
The Professional Doctorate in Engineering program Data Science is a two-year post-master's program. It qualifies its students to become top-level professional data scientists.

Data Science is concerned with the problem of finding patterns and creating value from vast streams of data in the context of a data domain. The main themes of the program are: • Collect, explore, analyze, interpret, and present huge data sets • Approach data and domain problems from multiple perspective • Create value for organizations by designing novel data driven solutions The program combines statistics, computer science, mathematics, and design theory with the business acumen to explore data sets, gather insights, visualize results, and communicate meaningful findings to stakeholders taking into consideration underlying ethical and legal aspects. About PDEng A PDEng program is a more industry-oriented alternative to a PhD trajectory. Whilst a PhD is focused on a career as an independent researcher, a PDEng prepares a trainee for an industrial career as a technological designer. Like a PhD candidate, a PDEng candidate has the status of TU/e employee after being selected for this program, and receives a salary and attractive benefits package.

The PDEng program Data Science qualifies its students to become top-level professionals, who are able to help industry and business with their innovative data science solutions. They aim for a career in a big data environment that truly leverages their academic experience and talents in the fast growing in-demand field of Data Science. A Data Science graduate:
Properly applies techniques from statistics, computer science, and mathematics in a variety of data domains.
Shows curiosity with the desire to discover, distil, and model a problem down to a clear set of concepts and hypotheses to be tested.
Uses data to tell a story and communicate that story effectively to stakeholders.
Demonstrates cleverness to look at a problem in different creative ways.
Collaborates in teams and with a variety of stakeholders to get optimal results.
